name: 365 Button Ritual
description: A quirky, DIY-focused movement rooted in 'main character energy' and personal productivity. Consumers are using buttons as daily trackers or eclectic accessories, driven by the motto: 'It only has to make sense to me.'
marketing_angle: Empower your customers' personal quirks. Use phrases like 'it only has to make sense to you,' 'track your year in style,' and 'curate your daily ritual.' Highlight the therapeutic nature of DIY crafting.

name: 2016 Nostalgia (2026 Revival)
description: The 10-year nostalgia cycle has arrived. Social media is flooded with '2026 is the new 2016' content, reviving the Snapchat era, boho-festival fashion, and 'simpler times' aesthetics.
marketing_angle: Tap into the 'simpler times' sentiment. Use marketing copy like '2026 is the new 2016,' 'throwback essentials,' and 'bring back the dog-ear era.' Position products as modern takes on classic 2016 staples.

name: Personalized Plushie Collectibles
description: Plushies (led by the Jellycat craze) have evolved from toys to essential lifestyle accessories. The trend focuses on hyper-personalization, including custom embroidery and rainbow-dyeing.
marketing_angle: Focus on the 'unboxing' experience and 'emotional support' value. Market these as 'one-of-a-kind companions' and offer customization options like name embroidery or unique color ways to appeal to collectors.

name: Vintage Tech & Digicam Aesthetic
description: A rejection of high-definition smartphone photography in favor of the grainy, warm, and authentic feel of early 2000s digital cameras and analog film.
marketing_angle: Market the 'aesthetic of imperfection.' Promote products that help customers capture memories with a 'soulful, retro vibe' rather than clinical smartphone precision. Use 'digicam' and 'Y2K' in product titles.

name: Unfiltered Authenticity (The Anti-Delulu)
description: A cultural pivot away from 'delusional positivity' and highly curated feeds toward raw, behind-the-scenes (BTS) content and honest storytelling.
marketing_angle: Stop selling 'perfect' and start selling 'real.' Use your marketing to show the messy, honest process of making your products. Phrases like 'unfiltered and honest' or 'no-nonsense quality' will resonate.

name: Retro Sporty Print Revival
description: Bold patterns like thick stripes and playful polka dots are overtaking solid colors. This trend draws from 90s/2000s sporty and preppy aesthetics for high-impact daily wear.
marketing_angle: Encourage 'pattern play' and 'bold mixing.' Position these prints as the fun, high-energy alternative to boring basics. Use slogans like 'don't blend in' and 'modern retro vibes.'
